title: Prevent and Treat Snow Blindness
brief: Protect eyes from UV reflection off snow using sunglasses or improvised eye protection.
steps: Step 1: Wear sunglasses when in snowy conditions with sun exposure.
Step 2: If no sunglasses available, cut narrow slits in cardboard, thin wood, or tree bark.
Step 3: Put soot under your eyes to reduce glare and shine.
Step 4: If symptoms develop (gritty feeling, eye pain, redness, tearing, headache), bandage eyes until symptoms disappear.
warnings: Sun's UV rays reflect at all angles from snow, ice, and water.
Symptoms include grit sensation in eyes, pain increasing with eye movement, red teary eyes, and light-sensitive headache.
Exposure is worse at high altitudes than low altitudes.
Prolonged exposure can cause permanent eye damage.
